Reviews.Content: We stayed11 nights at this lovely hotel over Xmas and New Year's.Absolutely hepful staff that went over and above what I usually expect from personnel.The two ladies who worked the breakfast room every morning were funny,cheerful and a joy to see every day.Our room was always cleaned,towels were changed daily and there was always lots of hot water.I always felt safe in the hotel.We had a room facing the street but it was so quiet because the hotel is just off the main road.The room had heavy drapes that blocked off light at night.Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost like home when a long way from home”
Reviews.Author: FrancophileOZ
Reviews.Content: My second time. Convenient location with Pernety metro a minute walk away: never waited more than 3 mins for a train. Good restaurants nearby. Hotel staff welcoming, and incredibly helpful. 24 hr reception. Le Patron a true gentleman, to his staff as to his guests. He remembered me from a year ago, when he asked my opinion on his proposed renovations, now complete [and very fine they are, too!]. Good breakfast. Rooms tiny yet comfortable, but that's part of the Paris experience!! A laundry nearby, in rue de l'Ouest [there are some others, near Pernety station - but not so good], will take most excellent care of one's laundry - same day service. La Poste is around the corner, too. Is in predominantly residential area, so a true village experience; Sunday morning/brunch in one of the local bistros is cool and laid-back - with very few tourists. This hotel was originally recommended to me by a Parisian medical colleague of mine: best advice he ever gave me :). I'll be back again in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean accomodation for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: nyikoka
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean rooms, fully refurbished. Not the biggest rooms though, but good enough. Breakfast in the basement, good french stuff. Close to public transport, good location. Extremely friendly staff, actually this is the most appealing factor. There's also free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern if small rooms. Friendly staff and good location.”
Reviews.Author: mynameisjonas
Reviews.Content: Was travelling with my father and girlfriend for a one night stop in paris before heading south. We were all pleasantly surprised by the hotel which while one of the cheapest in the areas felt clean and modern. My only criticism would be that the rooms are a little on the small side with no frills or luxuries apart from a small empty fridge. The hotel is just a stones throw away from Pernaty metro station and a short 10 minute walk from the Gare Monparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with my too-brief stay”
Reviews.Author: joie952
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Apollon Montparnasse while passing through Paris on my way from London to New York. After having stayed a week in London at a similarly-priced but shabby hotel, the Apollon was a breath of fresh air. The receptionists could not have been friendlier or more helpful and welcoming. The room was small - expected - but with simple but lovely decor, and clean and well-appointed. Despite being there on a Sunday night, I did find several places open late to eat. I'd highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, cosy and friendly - and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ali_and_Hein
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely place to begin and end each day of the seven we spent in Paris. Yes the room was small... but hey! it is Paris. The hotel is 2 mins walk to Pernety Metro station so it was incredibly easy to get to and from most of the major destinations. Room temp was nice, the bed comfy, the shower never lacked hot water. Who'd have thought that in a wee room you could also fit a desk, minifridge and cupboard. Breakfast was simple though each and every croissant and bagette was delicious. The staff were keen to help and had very decent english-language abilities. The immediate neighbourhood includes a post office, ATMs, fresh food shops and laundrettes. Paris is a wonderful city all on its own, but it certainly helps to stay in a place like Hotel Apollon were nothing was too much trouble and the room was a cosy haven to continue the romance of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a nice area. Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: Kingerdahill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a weekend in October. Was extremely pleased with the hotel. It was better than a two star and the superior room we had booked was very clean and good value for money. It was not massive but of an ok size. i was actually expencting it to be tiny! The area is nice but be warned that most shops close on a sunday and monday. Went to Nuxis restaurant on the Saturday night which was memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a pricey city - wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: VinSomething
Reviews.Content: I originally had reservations at a different hotel in the city, but after reading the reviews here I decided to change my reservation to the Apollon Montparnasse. I stayed for 4 nights with my wife in Room 301 - two other friends also stayed at the hotel in Room 404. Our Deluxe Room would be considered tiny in the USA, but we knew what to expect going in. Pros: Helpful and friendly staff 24x7, safe yet lively neighborhood, close to train station, pastry shops, ATM, restaurants, late-night "corner" store across the street for drinks/snacks, great value for price, free wireless Internet that was stable. Cons: No food in room policy, expensive breakfast (11 euro per person, didn't try it - went with crepes or other pastries for breakfast from local shops for much cheaper). Hotel name isn't clear from street - not sure if the name changed recently - but I walked by a few times before figuring out I had to be in the right place. Oddities: You leave your roomkey with the front desk when you leave. It's strange and it bothered me at first for some reason, but I adjusted. I suggest the Air France bus to Montparnasse station. Not as close as Pernety but it's only a short (<10 min) walk away. Easier than navigating the Metro with bags and cheaper than a cab. Budget at least an hour for the ride to/from the airport. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat on my next trip to Paris. If you're looking for a cheap place to stay that's in a safe neighborhood close to the Metro then this is your place. Expect friendliness from the staff, but realize you are not staying in a 4 or 5 start hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, close amenities, not the best for tight budget or with small children”
Reviews.Author: AmericanInLeeds
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Apollon for four nights with my husband and four-year-old. The room was very clean and beds were comfortable. We felt welcome though sometimes misunderstood. Hotel has much to recommend it in terms of location: one block from Metro, 1/2 block from post office, 1/2 block from BNP Paribus cash machine (free use for Bank of America debit cards), easy walk to grocery stores (Ed and Franprix), 1/2 block from laundrette, and a couple of blocks from the best croissants we tasted all week, at La Fournee d'Augustine (96 rue Raymond-Losserand); also try the chouquettes at nearby Moulin de la Vierge (105 rue Vercingetorix). The more fit can even walk to the Eiffel Tower (past UNESCO) or Luxembourg Gardens. Two main complaints: 1) there's a strict "no food in the rooms" policy, which made it difficult to eat quick/cheap breakfast or dinner in the room, something we hoped to do and something that was almost necessary with a small child. Paradoxically, there was a fridge in the room, so we kept milk and juice on hand to tide us over until we could get our croissants nearby. (Hotel breakfast buffet was 11 euros; we never even considered it.) 2) the walls are very thin between rooms! We could hear our neighbors talking, showering, gargling, throwing things away in the bathroom trash, being intimate, and lots of slamming doors and going up and down the elevator. Luckily, we only had neighbors for two nights and they kept reasonable hours. Also note that this neighborhood is a good way from central Paris, but that has the bonus of not feeling so touristy.

Reviews.Title: “overall good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lemonlym
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the exterior was under construction but the inside was very nice and the staff very helpful. Rooms are modern with en-suite, TV and fridge. The breakfast is nice and the staff are helpful. Overall good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Chic and beautiful, the perfect place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: YoungExplorer6
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Apollon Montparnasse this september and were amazed at its chic interior. Our bedroom had been recently renovated and contained a flat screen tv, a large comfortable bed, a fridge, a desk and a telephone. The bathroom was beautiful- modern, clean and bright with an excellent shower. Each morning we had breakfast down in the cellar which was like an enchanted cave. We were presented with fresh coffee and croissants and a buffet of fruit salad, cold meats, yoghurts, bread, cereal as well as fruit juice. The location was also perfect as the restaurants surrounding us were used by the locals and we ate one fantastic meal at one nearby called 'Nexus.' It was an easy location to walk to the river from yet we also had the option of the metro which was literally just round the corner. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Need a good value hotel for a weekend in paris? Don't look any further.”
Reviews.Author: PZtraveller
Reviews.Content: just returned from a weekend away to celebtrate our 10th wedding aniversary, and Apollon Montparnasse was just what we wanted. Clean, close to the metro and incredibly good value. We had a superior double which was roomier than most in Paris. Service was excellent throughout and we were looked after from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. Would have no hesitation in going back. Check out AuMetro, opposite Pernety metro station for a good coffee, lunch or simply to sit and watch Paris go by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rednaxela11
Reviews.Content: After a long car journey we arrived at this hotel to find clean and comfortably furnished rooms and staff who went out of their way to ensure we had what we needed and were sufficiently organized to catch our plane the following morning. These guys were terrific, way better than what you might expect from a fairly modestly priced urban hotel. The location is a few blocks from the Montparnasse train station, making it a bit of a distance (probably twenty minutes by metro) from the main tourist sites but in my books that's a good thing because you don't have to deal with the crowds. I would stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly and Helpful, Very Clean, Good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: NiagaraRiver
Reviews.Content: My wife, our grandmother, and I traveled from America to Paris, and stayed here for three nights. Our rooms were small (like most rooms in Paris are), but they were modern and clean. It looked like the rooms had just been romodeled. Breakfast was free each morning. You go downstairs to a cute little breakfast room (we called it the "breakfast cave" because it had pretty stone block on the wall). A nice lady served us coffee and hot chocolate. There were plenty of criossants, baguettes, cereals, and juices to fill us up. I don't know if the breakfast is always free at this hotel, but when we reserved our room via the website, we were not charged. It was a wonderful bonus! Wireless internet worked fine on our laptop. And the best part - it was FREE. There was also a free, public access computer in the lobby. The hotel wasn't right in the middle of the tourist area, but the subway / metro was only a block away, so it was easy to get around. Around the block we fond and used a coin laundry shop, two grocery stores, and several little cafes. The neighborhood was very charming. Yohann, the desk manager, greeted us by name whenever we entered the building. He helped us set up our laptop for internet access, gave us directions to tourist attractions, and ordered a taxi for our last day. He is outgoing, funny, friendly, and he speaks English very well. THe hotel was a great value. In the future, when we return to Paris, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: monicaSouthCoast
Reviews.Content: Excellent location close to Metro and local cafes/bars. Wonderful shower and bed very comforatable. Johan on reception very friendly and helpful. Room clean and very good value for two star. Outside renovations did not affect my stay. would retun there again with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JAAIssaquah
Reviews.Content: After reading Trip Advisor reviews I picked the Apollon Montparnasse and we were pleased. The metro stop is a block away and there are Velib bikes to rent. The front desk staff speaks English and were always very nice and helpful. Emmanuel greeted us every morning by name with a big hello. They are doing some construction during the day but we were out all day so never heard it. We heard hardly any outside noise on the street but could hear a little from the adjoining room. The phone and WIFI worked. Room and bathroom are a typical small Paris size but we really only slept there and were gone till late at night. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: hatedtownhouse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel a year ago, when I went to Paris for the first time alone. I speak relatively limited French, and I was happy to find that the front desk staff was helpful, knowledgeable and understanding. As an American woman in her mid-thirties alone in Paris, I felt safe in this hotel. The fact that there is free Wi-Fi also made it easy for me to keep in contact with my husband and children via my laptap in my room. The room was small, but that is to be expected in Europe. The hotel has been redone within the last few years, and they keep it clean and orderly. It is a small hotel, but I'm fond of this type of hotel. The maid service and food service was on the slow side and seemed a tad disgruntled, but friendly and professional for the most part. The neighborhood is one of the best features of this hotel for me. It's really on the edge of Montparnasse, so you don't get the super touristy ritzy aspects of the heart of Montparnasse. Also, it's a hop-skip-jump away from the metro and there's a great cafe right up the street. There are two groceries stores nearby, and just about any kind of other store you'd like, including a charming little toy store around the corner. The people in the neighborhood were, in my experience, friendly to Americans and affable. Ultimately, you get what you pay for...a charming little room, helpful front desk, a sweet neighborhood and a decent overall stay. If you are looking for luxury or American-style rooms and staff, you'll have to pay a much higher price in a far more touristy neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great service, great local location"”
Reviews.Author: gigi385
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It wasn't large, but it had amazing service and lovely rooms. They weren't super fancy but the decor was fun and everything was very clean. The bathroom was recently remodeled and was beautiful! The bathroom actually was pretty fancy. We had a room with a view of the street and that was a great deal of fun. A little noisy at night with the window open, but we enjoyed the sounds of the streets. The location was perfect for us. It was more of a local, working part of the city. We had a ball meeting and talking with local Parisians in the stores (rather than other tourists).

Reviews.Title: “Ongoing Construction & A Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yulin_jiang
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for five nights in late June. Here are some of our feedback: 1. It is a very basic hotel and a 2-star hotel. So if you want to stay in a nice hotel, it is a wrong choice. The room is small but clean. 2. Location: close to a subway, but not close to the Elf Tower. Paris' Metro is convenient but dirty. 3. The renovation is still going on. The workers started to work early at 8:30am. I understand the hotel needs renovation, but I just do not like the noise and the mess. 4. Service people are friendly. A plus for the hotel. Before we visited Paris, we heard some rumors about French. It turns out French are friendly people. Love their lifestyle.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Europe2009_withkids
Reviews.Content: If you're planning to use the subway / Metro to get around, this place is the best. Not a "walk to the Eiffel Tower" hotel but only 90 feet from the Pernety subway stop (you see the hotel sign as you exit) this quiet neighborhood has lots of decent restaurants (the Chineese Trattoria is a fast, cheap, good - they'll provide plates and forks if asked. The spicy shrimp and the "sugar" pork fed a family of 4 for 29 euros!) For a more parisian taste, the Cafe Metro was very good. Traveling with 4 it's impossible to find rooms in Paris in June, but they put us up in two adjoining rooms. Desk clerk was ALWAYS friendly, owner drew us a map to the bus stop to the airport (5 minute walk) saving us $100 on a taxi ride. Free Wi-Fi (pronounced wee-fee) in all rooms. The free breakfast is wonderful - baguette, croissant, cheese, ham, milk, juice, coffee, cereal, and lots of it. Save you probably 8 euros a day per person, compared to prices down the street. They ARE doing rennovations in the hallway - plaster dust and plastic on the floor - through August - but the rooms are immaculately clean, air conditioned, with private bathrooms. Small, but the norm for Paris. Elevator is 2-person sized. I'd stay again. The staff is so friendly you wonder who started those rumors that Parisians are anything but wonderful. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: msts80231
Reviews.Content: I needed a place for one night after an overnight flight from the US, leaving the next am early from Montparnasse station. As noted by another reviewer, it's really about a 10 minute walk to the train/Air France bus, but it was an easy walk even with (rolling) luggage and you didn't have to depend on getting a taxi. The Pernety metro station is really close and goes straight to the "action" i.e. Concorde. My room was ready when I arrived at 11 a.m. which was great, and the cost was $116 booked over the internet. The room was very small, a single room actually, and you could barely turn around in the shower but it was clean and more than fine for a tired traveler. There was a small refrigerator and T.V. with CNN, soundproof windows and comfortable bed. There was also a computer available for free, which I learned from the rest of my trip was a real luxury - especially since it takes a while to adapt to a French keyboard. I got Vietnamese take-out from a shop by the metro, and other options were available in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great Parisian neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: JG-travelers
Reviews.Content: We exited the Pernety metro stop, and the Apollon was 50m to our left. The staff was very friendly and helpful, esp. Yohann, the rooms recently refurbished, and rooms and bath were extremely clean. Typically small as Paris hotel rooms go, but plenty of room for my wife and me. The neighborhood along Rue Raymond Losserand is classic Parisian with all of the local shops and restaurants. Our next stop was St. Emilion in Bordeaux, and the Gare Montparnasse was a 10 min walk to the TGV.

Reviews.Title: “Perfekte Lage”
Reviews.Author: loataonata
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights with my girlfriend in the hotel. We have chosen it for the price and situation close to train, metro and the city center. The quarter is a really nice one with a perfekt and trendy place to breakfast, brunch, eat and drink called "au metro". It`s directly in front of the metro station and a typical parisian cafÃ© with nice chairs to sit and watch the people passing by. A full and very good breakfast is 8 â‚¬ which seemed superfair to us - the perfekt start to make plans for the day. The quarter is really save, quiet but interesting. I really can recommend the hotel just for the perfekt typical parisian quarter and it`s super location. All sights are superclose by and quickly accessible by the very good metro system of even by walking - no problems at all. Also important the safety of the quarter - never had any problems also when walking home very late at night. The hotel itself is also great - the people very very friendly. Currently there are renovations going on which no one told us but it wasnÂ´t that tragic. The rooms are small but really sufficient - beds and bathroom all clean and pleasant. All in all for a young couple like us in charge of a romantic paris trip the perfect choice - the weekend was a full success also because the hotel was well chosen. Real luxury you will find somewhere else but for Paris I really think it`s a good price for value deal. Have fun and a pleasant stay !

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Paris base”
Reviews.Author: Mathematica
Reviews.Content: Receptionist helpful when we arrived early. Bedroom small - not room for much more than the beds - no storage furniture at all. Did have effective double glazing and air conditioning. Bathroom reasonable, though shower cabinet small. Breakfast had decent buffet, though not as big a range as larger hotels. Claim that it is 3 minutes walk from Montparnasse station is dubious - certainly not with cases. It is very close to Pernety on line 13 - useful for going up to centre, less so for connecting to mainline stations. Range of cheap restaurants and creperies in nearby streets.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Desk Staff, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: strawberryfrog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in February and again in March. I mainly chose it for proximity to Le Cordon Bleu, where I was taking cooking classes (it's a quick bus ride, a 20 minute walk, or an 8 minute bike ride). It's far from most of the sites, but a great place if you want a real Parisian neighborhood slice of life. The rooms are newly redone and very clean, tiny (of course, it's Paris after all). Spotless bathroom. It's less noisy than some other Parisian hotels I've stayed in, but still some noise from other hotel guests (doors opening and shutting mainly). Last time I stayed, they emphasized the no-smoking policy, yet when I left my room in the morning, the hallway smelled like an ashtray. As a woman traveling alone, I felt completely safe in this hotel and in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Strictly OK type!!!”
Reviews.Author: vasco-da-gama7
Reviews.Content: On our vacation to Paris we choose this Hotel,which was somewhat off the track and bit obscure only based on Trip advisor's reviews and previously we were always happy in choosing hotels as per the ratings of Trip advisor.----- but this can not be said true this time. My wife and myself were in this Hotel for 3 nights in the month of May, Booking was done directly with the Hotel and I must admit that despite being a typical Parisian Hotel the response was super fast!!! The front desk team especially Emmanual and Yohannan are excellent communicator and speak reasonably good English. They would even go an extra mile to help you out. We have had heard a lot about typical Parisian attitude, but mercifully this Hotel does not show them any. We got a special internate rate of 110 Euro per night with breakfast for a double,not bad at all looking at other Hotel's rate this was a steal!!! They send me a clear direction,how to reach to the Hotel beforehand and till that time I was overawed by their efficiency. The location is good,but it is subjective! If you are familiar with Paris Metro then Line 13 is not a problem at all. Though it was my first time in Paris but I did a fair amount of homework to familiarize myself with the complexity of Paris metro. Thank God!! It turned out to be gold! We could explore Paris to the tee in the shortest possible time due to Metro.We came back with a very high opinion about Paris Metro,and would strongly suggest people to use it to avoid the traffic and it is quite cheap too. A box of 10 tickets (Carnet) costs us 11.40 Euro,each ticket can be used as long as you are with in the Metro network,that means any number of changes can be covered by a single ticket only. But a word of caution! If you have some luggages with you then be prepared for a good weight lifting workout!!! Quite a few of the Metro stations do not have any escalators or elevators! so the good old stairs have to be negotiated.(Pernety is one of them!) The location of this Hotel is 50meters away from the Pernety station in Metro line 13,which is definitely a big advantage. The Hotel is at least not a pretender! It is a 2star and it declares that,I liked that. Check- in procedure was smooth and fast. The Elevator of the Hotel is an antique, probably from the time of French Revolution!!! If you get in to it with your luggage, then the other person has to wait!!! They definitely need to change the lift as soon as possible. The room was small to say the least!!!. There was hardly any space to move with out banging each other! The toilet was even smaller. if anybody is over 6ft and around 90+kg,then please avoid this Hotel as you will not be able to enter the shower cubicle!!! In the positive side there is an Aircon and it works! Good water pressure and hot water. A lot of reviewer had complained about the low energy lamps,but we did not find them as an irritation! Sound proofing is bad and you can listen to all the conversation of the adjacent rooms. The noise from the road was audiable till mid night!!! But I guess in Paris one need not complain about small room and bath!!! Had I been there for my work I would take it but probably not when you are on a vacation with your family. Breakfast was served in the cellar. It was just OK. Nothing great about it,but the coffee was plentiful and good so was the fresh croissant. There are a lots of good restaurants in the vicinity. Couple of Bristos near the Metro station,and one excellent Chinese small food joint nearby. On the other side of the Hotel there is a very good Lebanese Restaurant. Prices are very reasonable in all the places. We really do not know in Paris how small are the other Hotel rooms but if they are as small as this place then this Hotel would score over a lot of places because of their location and helpful attitude. Will we come back here again ? Ho... Hummm..... May be, may be not!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel, convenient for Metro and Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Andy_B_of_Rawdon
Reviews.Content: A small comfortable hotel in a relatively quiet, 'normal' area of the capital. Away from the masses of tourists and attractions but only 100 metres away from the Metro (Pernety). We found plenty of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel - enjoyed Il Gallo Nero on rue Raymond Losserand and a North African restaurant called Hamdous Ali on rue Moulin Vert (huge amount of meat with the Couscous). Staff were friendly and when asked to recommend a restaurant checked to see if it was open as it was a Sunday night. The room was very clean and it had a bath - great for soaking in after tramping around the streets for hours. Plenty of hot water instantly available. Some noise from a party in the adjoining apartment block on the first night was the only negative issue. Like another reviewer we found the room a bit dim until the economy light bulbs had warmed up. One good feature was that there was no mini bar but an empty fridge for keeping our bottled water in. Didn't try the breakfast as it seemed expensive at 11 euros (and we over slept one morning) but there are a couple of good cafes near the Metro for breakfast (and a late night tipple). Would use this hotel again on a visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant hotel, spoilt only by an expensive breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: x7Stuart
Reviews.Content: Everything that other reviewers have said in favour of this hotel is true. It's a charming place in a delightful area. The only shame was that the breakfast had gone up from â‚¬6.50 in the guidebook to â‚¬11 which meant we, too, left and went to the cafÃ© along the street.

Reviews.Title: “A good value, convenient location, friendly staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: FrankoPhile10
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. It was less than a block to the Metro, some decent eateries and bakeries. The surrounding area was safe and active, even at night. Walk less than two blocks straight out the front door for a nice view of the Eiffel Tower. The rooms were small but always neat, clean and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking little find”
Reviews.Author: Loudon111
Reviews.Content: A small friendly hotel just outside City Centre but with a Metro station within a minutes walk its all very accessible. The rooms are on the small side but spotlesley cleaned every day but with so much to do in Paris they were literally somewhere to lay ones head. The staff were very knowledgable and helpful at all times. Would use again on our next Parisian adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: MB58
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a business meeting in nearby Malakoff. Location is ideal, a minute from Pernity metro and less than 10 minutes walk from Gare Montparnasse and the Air France airport bus terminus. Pernity has cafes or there is a bigger selection around Montparnasse, so lack of a restaurant is no problem. And there is a specialist beer shop over the road so leave room in your suitcase! Room was fairly small but nicely decorated with air conditioning, a small fridge and a comfortable bed - the bathroom was excellent with a good shower. Only criticism was the room lighting was a bit dim, especially until the low-energy bulbs have warmed up. Breakfast in the cellar is simple but at least you get your own roll and croissant, so no fighting over the buffet. Not a huge spread but everything you need. In summary - a good, reasonably priced hotel in a pleasant area with good transport links.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: SAtraveller4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the Metro. The hotel room was small but had everything we needed. The best feature is the helpfulness of the guy at the front desk who really went out of his way to giuve advice and make our stay pleasant. This is reason enough to stay there. Otherwise the hotel was reasonably priced for Paris and the breakfast room is quaint and breakast is the only bargain you will get in Paris! Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neubauten
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a single room over New Year. Room was small but adequate and very clean, though the walls seem a bit thin, so if you have a noisy neighbour you can hear their conversation! Breakfast is EUR9, not too bad considering the price of things in Paris. The hotel Manager was very helpful, as were all the staff we came in contact with. The lift only takes 2 people at a time, but the stairs were good exercise. There area around the hotel is quiet and there is a supermarket about 5 minutes from the hotel & the metro is a block down, very convenient. I enjoyed my stay and would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff, and VERY VERY Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: flightkid
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and the experience was fantastic. The people at the receptionist desk were outstanding. They greeted us by our names and took great care of us. The rooms were ultra clean, great amenities, and quiet area! The hotel is located only a block from the metro making it so easy to get to the heart of Paris in less than 15 min. We had a great experience with this hotel and will for sure stay again here at this hotel! Happy Holidays everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: TomfromDallas
Reviews.Content: I can safely say this hotel is an excellent bargain. The rooms were clean and the service was excellent. All of the front desk personnel remembered our names and greeted us every time we walked in. Everyone spoke very good English. The hotel is well located, 50 yards from a metro station and only a couple of blocks form the main Montparnasse station. While not the largest hotel room in the world, certainly acceptable from a European standpoint and extremely clean and updated. I would defintitely stay at this hotel again and would be comfortable recommending to friends and family!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Apollon Montparnasse
HotelInfo.Address: 91 Rue de l'Ouest | 14 Arr., 75014 Paris, France
